result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan J Armao was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as a condition of probation and to be paid before costs or fines for:
Piggly Wiggly in the amount of $685.16
Joel R. in the amount of $500.00
American Family Insurance in the amount of $2,835.00
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with: Any Piggly Wiggly Store, Rudolph and Suzanne F. and their residence, Dan's L&L Fine Jewerly or any other pawn shop, or Joel R. and his residence.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Any other term deemed appropriate by agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not already previously obtained.  
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with standard release conditions.  Sentence beginning forthwith.
9/29/2016 - COURT GRANTS REQUEST - RELEASE FOR ELDER CARE FOR 6 HOURS A DAY.

Defendant Jonathan J Armao in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address reinstatement of Defendant's Huber privileges.   Attorney Kershek requests the Court reinstate the Huber privileges in a few weeks.    Captain Schnabl addresses the Court and objects to the reinstatement of the Huber privileges.  The Court does not take any action at this time and orders that the Defendant's Huber privileges remain revoked.
